pages.title: Overview
pages.purpose: Introduce the aisdk package, explaining its purpose as a production-grade AI SDK for R, its layered architecture, and key capabilities for building AI-powered applications with agents, tools, and multi-provider support

pages.title: Getting Started
pages.purpose: Guide users through installation, initial setup, and their first interactions with aisdk

pages.title: Installation
pages.purpose: Explain how to install aisdk, system requirements, dependencies, and initial configuration including API keys

pages.title: Quick Start
pages.purpose: Provide minimal working examples showing text generation, basic agent usage, and simple tool calling to get users productive immediately

pages.title: Core Concepts
pages.purpose: Introduce fundamental concepts: Agents, ChatSessions, Tools, Providers, and the ReAct loop pattern used throughout aisdk

pages.title: Architecture
pages.purpose: Explain the four-layer architecture (Specification, Utilities, Provider, Core) and how components interact

pages.title: Layered Design
pages.purpose: Detail the four architectural layers, their responsibilities, and how the separation of concerns enables extensibility

pages.title: Provider Abstraction
pages.purpose: Explain the LanguageModelV1 and EmbeddingModelV1 interfaces, how they enable pluggable AI providers, and the benefits of abstraction

pages.title: Agent System Design
pages.purpose: Describe the agent-based architecture, ChatSession state management, and how agents coordinate through shared context

pages.title: Core API
pages.purpose: Document the high-level API functions that users interact with for text generation, streaming, embeddings, and structured output

pages.title: Text Generation
pages.purpose: Document generate_text(), its parameters, tool execution loop (max_steps), hooks integration, and result handling

pages.title: Streaming
pages.purpose: Explain stream_text(), callback pattern, real-time token streaming, and handling of streaming tool calls

pages.title: Embeddings
pages.purpose: Document the embed() function, supported models, and working with vector embeddings

pages.title: Structured Output
pages.purpose: Explain generate_object(), schema definition with z_object DSL, and generating type-safe R objects from AI models

pages.title: Provider System
pages.purpose: Explain how aisdk integrates with multiple AI model providers through a unified interface

pages.title: Provider Interfaces
pages.purpose: Document the LanguageModelV1 and EmbeddingModelV1 abstract interfaces, do_generate, do_stream, format_tool_result, and GenerateResult

pages.title: OpenAI Provider
pages.purpose: Document OpenAIProvider, OpenAILanguageModel, configuration options, supported models, and provider-specific features

pages.title: Anthropic Provider
pages.purpose: Document AnthropicProvider, AnthropicLanguageModel, message formatting differences, prompt caching, and Claude-specific features

pages.title: Provider Registry
pages.purpose: Explain ProviderRegistry, model resolution from string IDs (e.g., 'openai:gpt-4o'), and registering custom providers

pages.title: Agent System
pages.purpose: Document the Agent and ChatSession classes that enable autonomous AI entities and multi-agent coordination

pages.title: Agent Class
pages.purpose: Document the Agent R6 class, its properties (name, description, system_prompt, tools), the run() method, and as_tool() for delegation

pages.title: ChatSession
pages.purpose: Document ChatSession state management: message history, memory (key-value store), shared R environment, send/send_stream methods, and persistence

pages.title: Multi-Agent Workflows
pages.purpose: Explain how multiple agents share a ChatSession, cross-agent data sharing via environment and memory, and coordination patterns

pages.title: Flow Orchestration
pages.purpose: Document the Flow class, AgentRegistry for service discovery, hierarchical task delegation, and max_depth limiting

pages.title: Tools & Skills
pages.purpose: Explain how to extend agent capabilities with tools and organize them into reusable skills

pages.title: Creating Tools
pages.purpose: Document the tool() constructor, defining tool names/descriptions/parameters/execute functions, and tool execution contexts

pages.title: Tool Schemas
pages.purpose: Explain the z_schema DSL (z_object, z_string, z_number, z_array, etc.), JSON Schema generation, and parameter validation

pages.title: Skills System
pages.purpose: Document the Skill R6 class, SKILL.md format, progressive disclosure (3 levels), script execution with callr isolation, and SkillRegistry

pages.title: Tool Execution
pages.purpose: Explain execute_tool_calls, ReAct loop mechanics, tool result formatting, and execution environments

pages.title: Integrations
pages.purpose: Document how aisdk integrates with Shiny, console interfaces, and RMarkdown/Quarto
